result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Lipsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Continue paying probation fees. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - on the condition that he is compliant with probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Sentencing hearing at 01-12-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Anthony D Lipsey in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1 w/o the repeater.
Rights Given
P- NC 
BTC: Finding of guilt as to count 1 w/o the repeater. Waive PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report within 24 hrs of release to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
